intro: Wibelia pectinalis, commonly known as the beakweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Wibelia pectinalis is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
